SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.managers

Class PowerUpManager

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.managers.PowerUpManager
public class PowerUpManager extends Object
Manages all power-ups in the game, including spawning, updating, and handling collisions.

This class implements the Singleton pattern to ensure that only one instance manages power-ups.

  • Field Details

    • powerUps

      protected List<ActiveActorDestructible> powerUps

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static PowerUpManager getInstance()
      Returns the Singleton instance of the PowerUpManager. Creates a new instance if one does not already exist.
      Returns:
      The Singleton instance of PowerUpManager.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(javafx.scene.Group root)
      Initializes the PowerUpManager with the root group. This method should be called once when the level is initialized.
      Parameters:
      root - The root group to which power-ups will be added in the scene.

    • addPowerUp

      public void addPowerUp(PowerUp powerUp)
      Adds a new power-up to the game. The power-up is added to the internal list and the scene graph.
      Parameters:
      powerUp - The power-up to be added.

    • updatePowerUps

      public void updatePowerUps()
      Updates all active power-ups. This method should be called in the game loop to update the state or position of power-ups.

    • removeDestroyedPowerUps

      public void removeDestroyedPowerUps()
      Removes all destroyed power-ups from the game. Power-ups marked as destroyed are removed from both the internal list and the scene graph.

    • handlePowerUpCollisions

      public void handlePowerUpCollisions(CollisionManager collisionManager)
      Handles collisions between the player and power-ups. Delegates collision detection and response to the CollisionManager.
      Parameters:
      collisionManager - The CollisionManager responsible for detecting collisions.

    • clearAllPowerUps

      public void clearAllPowerUps()
      Clears all power-ups from the game. Removes all power-ups from both the internal list and the scene graph.

    • getPowerUpCount

      public int getPowerUpCount()
      Retrieves the total number of active power-ups currently managed by the power-up manager.

      This method returns the size of the collection that tracks all active power-ups in the game.

      Returns:
      The number of active power-ups.
